docs.abstract: Tracing community activism back a hundred years, Nina Banks says this labor by Black women should be counted as part of the economy.
docs.snippet: Tracing community activism back a hundred years, Nina Banks says this labor by Black women should be counted as part of the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every year women do trillions of dollars’ worth of unpaid household work. In the United States alone, that total amounted to roughly $1.2 trillion in 2019, a figure nearly the size of the New York State economy.

headline.main: The Economist Placing Value on Black Women’s Overlooked Work
headline.print_headline: Putting Value on Black Women’s Activism

docs.abstract: After a white nationalist rally led to melees and the death of a 32-year-old woman, the city tried to recover — as the police, in particular, came in for criticism.
docs.snippet: After a white nationalist rally led to melees and the death of a 32-year-old woman, the city tried to recover — as the police, in particular, came in for criticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. — Brittany Caine-Conley, a minister in training at Sojourners United Church of Christ, arrived in downtown Charlottesville on Saturday morning expecting that there might be violence. She did not expect things to get out of hand so quickly.

headline.main: Hurt and Angry, Charlottesville Tries to Regroup From Violence
headline.print_headline: Hurt and Angry, Charlottesville Tries to Regroup

docs.abstract: The longtime Georgetown coach, who died in August at 78, writes about his upbringing and his remarkable career in “I Came as a Shadow.”
docs.snippet: The longtime Georgetown coach, who died in August at 78, writes about his upbringing and his remarkable career in “I Came as a Shadow.”
docs.lead_paragraph: “I’m six feet 10 inches tall,” the longtime Georgetown basketball coach John Thompson writes in his posthumously published autobiography. “I have a large mouth, a big head and a deep voice. I naturally make a big noise. Not only am I Black, but I have dark skin. My feet are big, my body is big. Sometimes I’m loud, but I’m loud because I’m composed of big things.”

headline.main: In His Autobiography, the College Basketball Giant John Thompson Is Plainspoken and Profound
headline.print_headline: Some Big Thoughts From a Big Man

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: I Came As a Shadow: An Autobiography (Book)

docs.abstract: This June has restored the spirit of protest to Pride celebrations. Here are shows to help you understand the moment.
docs.snippet: This June has restored the spirit of protest to Pride celebrations. Here are shows to help you understand the moment.
docs.lead_paragraph: This year, Pride has been forced back to its roots. Instead of celebrities waving from floats sponsored by TD Bank and Absolut Vodka, pandemic-masked protesters are marching in the streets demanding justice for black lives. Rainbow flags have been replaced with signs with the names of those killed by the police, like Tony McDade, a black trans man in Tallahassee, Fla. These protests may be perhaps the most genuine honoring of Pride, an annual commemoration of the 1969 Stonewall uprising, in which black and brown L.G.B.T.Q. people were a driving force. There is much to learn this Pride, and a legion of queer voices in podcasting can help you gain insight, find representation and feel comfort during this time. Here are a few of our recommendations.

headline.main: 5 Podcasts at the Intersection of Pride Month and the Black Lives Matter Movement

docs.abstract: Plans to ensure safe classes vary by province and school board or are still in the works. Two experts offer their views on what’s ahead.
docs.snippet: Plans to ensure safe classes vary by province and school board or are still in the works. Two experts offer their views on what’s ahead.
docs.lead_paragraph: For many families, back-to-school season can be a fraught time. But this year, the pandemic may take that tension to a whole new height.

headline.main: Will It Be Safe to Return to School?

docs.abstract: Several Black City Council members have lashed out at progressives, comparing calls to defund the police to “colonization” and “political gentrification.”
docs.snippet: Several Black City Council members have lashed out at progressives, comparing calls to defund the police to “colonization” and “political gentrification.”
docs.lead_paragraph: With New York City on the cusp of cutting $1 billion from the Police Department, a city councilwoman, Vanessa L. Gibson, told her colleagues that enough was enough.

headline.main: Who Opposes Defunding the N.Y.P.D.? These Black Lawmakers
headline.print_headline: ‘Defund the Police.’ Not So Fast, Several Black Politicians Say.

docs.abstract: Five other people were wounded in the shooting, which the police said “appeared to be a confrontation between armed protesters and an armed homeowner.”
docs.snippet: Five other people were wounded in the shooting, which the police said “appeared to be a confrontation between armed protesters and an armed homeowner.”
docs.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — A deadly weekend shooting in Portland at a protest against police killings left one person dead and five others wounded, raising tensions once again among the city’s social justice activists.

headline.main: One Dead in Shooting at Portland Protest Against Police Violence
headline.print_headline: 1 Dead and 5 Wounded in Portland at Protest Against Police Killings

byline.original: By Sergio Olmos, Austin Ramzy and Melina Delkic

docs.abstract: But if the Democrats dare to use their power, a brave new world might be possible.
docs.snippet: But if the Democrats dare to use their power, a brave new world might be possible.
docs.lead_paragraph: There are two images. In one, National Guard troops, most with no identifying information on their uniforms, stand on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial in anticipation of violence from people peacefully protesting the killing of George Floyd. In the second image, thousands of protesters — domestic terrorists, really — swarm the Capitol. They wear red MAGA hats and carry Trump flags and show their faces because they want to be seen. They don’t seem to fear the consequences of being identified. More images — a man sitting in Nancy Pelosi’s office, his feet on a desk, a smirk on his face. A man carrying a stolen lectern, smiling at the camera. A man in the Senate chamber doing parkour.

headline.main: We’ve Seen the Ugly Truth About America

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
